Ayurved College, Solapur Abstract - Vyayama or exercise has been a foremost part of ayurvedic lifestyle. Ancient ayurved scholars have given prime importance on it due to its benefits for mind, body, and soul. Lifestyle disorders are like a pandemic and become challenge for the medical field. Obesity, P.C.O.D. Diabetes, Cardiovascular diseases, joint diseases, stress are few of them. The cardinal cause is lack of proper exercise. People join yoga, Jim but could not find proper benefits from them. exercise in proper way enhances strength, endurance, firmness, fitness and increases ability to do work. When exercise is conducted according to prakriti, age, season it balances dosha. Vata type needs less exercise, pitta needs moderate while kapha needs more intense exercises such as jogging and aerobics. Winter and spring are best season for exercise. Childrens are having good stamina than elder people. Everyone should do it on regular basis according to age , season and stamina. Keywords – exercise, Vyayama, Prakriti, health, Yoga I. Review literature Prakriti is enumeration of body features internal as well as external. Prakriti of body type is a unique concept of Ayurveda determined by proportion of three Dosha. Ayurveda classified body types based on predominance of Dosha. This predominance depends upon predominance of Dosha is ovum and spermatozoon mean Shukra and Shonita 6. Ayurveda used the term Prakriti in the sense of personality. Ayurveda has given stress on constitutional, Temperamental, Psychological, and emotional aspects of personality. Vata individuals possess alpa Bala, pitta madhyam and kapha Uttam bala 7. By considering this fact one must select type of Vyayama. Assessment of sharirk bala is done by determining Vyayama shakti and Saar pariksha 8. Due to this Vyayama is included in dashvidh pariksha. Strength is the quality of being physically strong or the capacity of an individual to withstand stress. Exercise ( Vyayama according to Prakriti) a. Vata prakriti Key qualities for vata are warm, grounding, steady, slow Vata is arrhythmic, so rhythmic activities like dancing, rowing, yoga, swimming, and walking are usually good This would be warming, grounding, steady, and strength building type workouts. In Jim also one must select exercise according to dosha not only weight, B.M.R. and all things. Mild, regular exercise is key for vata. Connecting with the earth element can be very relaxing for this wind element. Hence, follow a regime that involves: • lying down on the earth or on the ground. • practicing yoga bare foot. Exercise for Pitta Prakriti Key qualities for pitta – Pitta is fiery and exercise increases the heat, pitta people need more care while exercise. Pitta individual do the workout about 70% of their capacity. For pitta, exercise is an important outlet for drive, sharp focus, and achievement – as well as a chance to simultaneously release internal pressure and embrace challenge. General tips for pitta person while exercising 1. The pitta region is around the navel, and hence the asanas that help balance pitta are those that place pressure on the naval and solar plexus region. 2. These asanas give pressure on liver, spleen, pancreas, intestines and thus helps to improve and maintain the agni (digestive fire). 3. The best asanas for pitta are those that are calming and not overly heating. 4. Pitta people have athletic bodies strong competitive spirit but after exercise they need to take rest. 5. To satisfy the pitta individuals’ competitive nature, a friendly game of basketball, tennis, or volleyball will be just fine if they are mindful to not become overly intense. Keep it fun . 6. Avoid exercise in hot weather or sun. prefer sheet kaal. 7. Wear loose cloth 8. Group games or exercise like badminton, cycling helps to ease pittas jealous and anger. 9. Drink water frequently as per season 10. Exercise may help to develop cool, calm effect 11. Do not exercise during stress or with anger. 12. tai chi and swimming are far more fluid and pitta-balancing forms of exercise than bodybuilding. 13. Try connecting with earth element – lying down 10. 14. Lying down—either on a firm floor or (when weather permits) outside, directly on the earth. 15. Place the feet on floor or ground and connect attention with earth. 16. Exercise in natural atmosphere involve senses in receiving natural world. 17. Always practicing yoga barefoot. 18. Do yoga or exercise in standing, balancing and supine position connecting to earth followed by shavasana. 19. Passive – delicate tender self-massage with oil. (As pitta skin is delicate self-massage will better choice for them) 20. Active- swimming, water skilling, aerobics, archery, game hunting, hiking jazz dancing horse riding tennis squash volleyball, basketball. 21. Sitting and lying poses can be practiced Passive & active- hatha yoga Seethali, Seetkari, Nadi shodhana, Sudarshana Kriya. c. Exercise for Kapha Prakriti Key qualities - The blending of the earth and water elements creates the qualities of heavy, slow, and stable. Kapha will benefit the most from being physical during the morning hours of 6–10 a.m., which is the kapha time of day. General rules for kapha exercise 1. They fond of active exercise. They have good, endurance, stamina. exercise help kapha to control weight improve circulation, mental stimulation. 2. The kapha sthana is chest, i.e., above the heart hence the stomach and chest are the areas where kapha accumulates. Exercises that require strength and stamina and that are stimulating and heating can be performed for a longer duration. 3. Kapha will benefit from movement that is light, sharp, hot, rough, and mobile such as Vigorous hiking, Cycling, Aerobics, cardio dance (like Zumba), or kick boxing. 4. Kapha can do any type of exercise 5. Active- short walks, bowling, football, basketball, horse riding, belly dance, cycling 6. Passive- deep massage, vigorously tapping of the body 7. Active & passive yoga postures, breathing exercises, 8. Yoga Asan – Kapalbhati, Uddiyan bandh, Uttanpadasan, sarvangasan , paschimotanasan , dhouti 9. Kapha can easily sit, concentrate, devotional, use perfumes, to keep senses alert. 10. Kapha should choose energetic, movable exercise. 11. Make body movable through exercise 12. During yoga and Jim sessions mild music, mantra make them enthusiastic. 13. Avoid exercise in cold weather best time for kapha is morning 6.00 to 10.00 am. 14. Avoid mild, stable movement. 15. Use perfumes for alertness. 16. Make your exercise routine as a celebration. 17. Kapha is steady, balanced by invigoration – physical, mental, and emotional. Practice invigorating Pranayama’s like Kapalbhati & Bhastrika. they will help invigorating mind, body and digestive capacity. Vata prakriti needs little amount of exercise, pitta needs moderate and kapha individuals can prefer heavy exercises.
